item.title: Elyse add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Freethinkers are those who are willing to use their minds without prejudice and without fearing to understand things that clash with their own customs, privileges, or beliefs. This state of mind is not common, but it is essential for right thinking..." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Just erotic. Nothing kinky. It's the difference between using a feather and using a chicken." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And what would humans be without love?" RARE, said Death." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Petting, scratching, and cuddling a dog could be as soothing to the mind and heart as deep meditation and almost as good for the soul as prayer." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "The heart is an artist that paints over what profoundly disturbs it, leaving on the canvas a less dark, less sharp version of the truth." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "After all, reading is arguably a far more creative and imaginative process than writing; when the reader creates emotion in their head, or the colors of the sky during the setting sun, or the smell of a warm summer's breeze on their face, they should reserve as much praise for themselves as they do for the writer - perhaps more." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "HOBBES: Virtue needs some cheaper thrills." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Every time I've built character, I've regretted it." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "If people persist in trespassing upon the grizzlies' territory, we must accept the fact that the grizzlies, from time to time, will harvest a few trespassers." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Chaos is found in greatest abundance wherever order is being sought. It always defeats order, because it is better organized." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "The emotional qualities are antagonistic to clear reasoning." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "When the rich wage war it's the poor who die." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "So this is hell. I'd never have believed it. You remember all we were told about the torture-chambers, the fire and brimstone, the "burning marl." Old wives' tales! There's no need for red-hot pokers. Hell is—other people!" -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Emmanuel Kant
item.description: "He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals." -- Emmanuel Kant

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Elyse add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "Those who restrain desire do so because theirs is weak enough to be restrained." -- William Blake

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "It may be that our role on this planet is not to worship God--but to create him." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde
